JUDGES: Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Vincent A. De Gaetano
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and is currently detained in GPE - FAC . He was represented before the Court by PERSON - GPE , a lawyer practising in PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant was sentenced to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment and was committed to PERSON . Since that date he has been continuously detained in several penitentiary facilities in GPE , PERSON , PERSON , GPE , PERSON and PERSON . On an unspecified date the applicant was transferred to FAC where he is currently detained .
The parties gave partly differing accounts of the conditions of the applicant ’s detention .
The applicant maintained that throughout his detention he was held in overcrowded cells .

Without submitting the exact statistics , the Government acknowledged that during the applicant ’s detention in FAC he had spent DATE in a cell in which the statutory minimum size of CARDINAL m² per person had not been respected . The Government did not comment on the level of overcrowding in the remaining penitentiary facilities . More recently , the ORG also submitted that on an unspecified date , presumably in DATE , the applicant had been placed in a cell in which the statutory minimum standard of CARDINAL m² per person was respected . The applicant did not contest this submission .
The applicant lodged several complaints with the penitentiary authorities regarding the conditions of his detention . CARDINAL of them was considered well - founded .

The applicant brought a civil action in tort against ORG statio fisci PERSON to seek compensation for the infringement of his personal rights . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s claim . The applicant appealed . On DATE the applicant was requested to pay a basic court fee in the amount of ORG ( approximately EUR CARDINAL.CARDINAL ) . In reply , the applicant requested the court to exempt him from payment of the basic court fee arguing that he was detained and lacked financial resources . On DATE the court dismissed the applicant ’s request stating that he had already been exempted from paying most of the court fees . On an unspecified date ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal on formal grounds . The applicant has not brought a civil action in respect of the remaining period of his detention .
( See PERSON and CARDINAL other applications v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
